abstracts.cdata!:
Although the project will improve
            accessibility to essential services, hence provide improved
            economic opportunities, the Resettlement Action Plan (RAP)
            proposes efforts to minimize adverse social impacts,
            continue the ongoing community consultation, develop an
            institutional framework for appropriate management, and,
            spells out that construction work, will only begin after
            land acquisition procedures are successfully initiated. The
            RAP presents mitigation measures to reduce land acquisition
            impacts on affected populations. The shortest possible
            length in road design was selected, to minimize land take,
            and in turn, avoid archaeological/cultural sites, as well as
            conservation or cultivation areas, allowing adjustments for
            the right of way. Through the Entitlement Framework,
            compensation and rehabilitation benefits to affected
            populations will be ensured. Compensation will cover the
            costs due to loss of land, and privately-owned assets, as
            well as adverse individual or collective impacts on
            subsistence, livelihood, or income-earning capacity.
            Payments will be in the form of cash lump sums, or two
            installments, be it for alternative accommodation or final
            replacement. Capacity-building initiatives will be provided,
            including training, and Local Consultative Forums will
            address social issues, inform on grievance resolution
            mechanisms, and monitor for adequate resettlement practices.
